glsa.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: A buffer underflow vulnerability and an information disclosure vulnerability have been discovered in OpenSSL.

background.p: OpenSSL is an implementation of the Secure Socket Layer and Transport Layer Security protocols.

description.p: Moritz Jodeit reported an off-by-one error in the SSL_get_shared_ciphers() function, resulting from an incomplete fix of CVE-2006-3738. A flaw has also been reported in the BN_from_montgomery() function in crypto/bn/bn_mont.c when performing Montgomery multiplication.

impact.p: A remote attacker sending a specially crafted packet to an application relying on OpenSSL could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A local attacker could perform a side channel attack to retrieve the RSA private keys.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
